nodes.text: The rules definitely need to be spelled out as specifically as possible
Vec(456): The rules definitely need to be spelled out as specifically as possible
Annot: The rules definitely need to be spelled out as specifically as possible
and should apply to all airlines
Vec(456): and should apply to all airlines
Annot: and should apply to all airlines
I don't trust the airlines to develop and enforce their own policy.
Vec(456): I don't trust the airlines to develop and enforce their own policy.
Annot: I don't trust the airlines to develop and enforce their own policy.
Previous experience with getting bumped off a flight (I was using miles) and the airline refused to put me on another carrier's flight
Vec(456): Previous experience with getting bumped off a flight (I was using miles) and the airline refused to put me on another carrier's flight
Annot: Previous experience with getting bumped off a flight (I was using miles) and the airline refused to put me on another carrier's flight
instead I had a flight that was six hours later with absolutely no compensation.
Vec(456): instead I had a flight that was six hours later with absolutely no compensation.
Annot: instead I had a flight that was six hours later with absolutely no compensation.
Basically the customer servie rep's attitude was "It's not my problem and you're using miles so we owe you nothing."
Vec(456): Basically the customer servie rep's attitude was "It's not my problem and you're using miles so we owe you nothing."
Annot: Basically the customer servie rep's attitude was "It's not my problem and you're using miles so we owe you nothing."
That's ridiculous.
REBacon(265): That's ridiculous.
Annot: That's ridiculous.
I agree that there needs to be some compensation for those who use miles.
REBacon(265): I agree that there needs to be some compensation for those who use miles.
Annot: I agree that there needs to be some compensation for those who use miles.
Also, airlines' refusal to put people on other airlines' flights has long annoyed me.
REBacon(265): Also, airlines' refusal to put people on other airlines' flights has long annoyed me.
Annot: Also, airlines' refusal to put people on other airlines' flights has long annoyed me.
I have no problem with airlines developing their own policies vice a mandated government requirement
JJMurray(365): I have no problem with airlines developing their own policies vice a mandated government requirement
Annot: I have no problem with airlines developing their own policies vice a mandated government requirement
but whatever those policies are they need to be easy to find, easy to read and understandable by your "average" person before someone books and pays for a flight.
JJMurray(365): but whatever those policies are they need to be easy to find, easy to read and understandable by your "average" person before someone books and pays for a flight.
Annot: but whatever those policies are they need to be easy to find, easy to read and understandable by your "average" person before someone books and pays for a flight.

If you want to regulate this then insist that all policies related to overbooking, rebooking, rerouting, basically any changes to the originally contracted flight must be made available in a format that is easily accessible and understandable to the general public.

JJMurray(365): If you want to regulate this then insist that all policies related to overbooking, rebooking, rerouting, basically any changes to the originally contracted flight must be made available in a format that is easily accessible and understandable to the general public.

Annot: If you want to regulate this then insist that all policies related to overbooking, rebooking, rerouting, basically any changes to the originally contracted flight must be made available in a format that is easily accessible and understandable to the general public.
